title: How to Make Chickpea and Feta Salad

steps.headline: Allow the chickpeas to soak in a cold water bowl overnight.
Thoroughly rinse the chickpeas and add them to a saucepan.
Bring them to a boil, then reduce the temperature to a medium heat.
steps.description: Cook for about 30 to 40 minutes until soft. Sprinkle a pinch or two of salt towards the end.

steps.headline: Drain the chickpeas completely.
steps.description: Be sure to double check if all the skins are off of the beans.

steps.headline: Lightly fry the chopped red onion with the olive oil in a saucepan.
steps.description: When it's lightly golden in color, add the garlic and chilli to the pan. Avoid browning the garlic and remove from the heat after a few minutes. Set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Combine the rest of the ingredients together and drizzle the garlic and olive oils on top.

text: Allow the chickpeas to soak in a cold water bowl overnight.  Thoroughly rinse the chickpeas and add them to a saucepan.  Bring them to a boil, then reduce the temperature to a medium heat. Cook for about 30 to 40 minutes until soft. Sprinkle a pinch or two of salt towards the end. Drain the chickpeas completely. Be sure to double check if all the skins are off of the beans. Lightly fry the chopped red onion with the olive oil in a saucepan. When it's lightly golden in color, add the garlic and chilli to the pan. Avoid browning the garlic and remove from the heat after a few minutes. Set aside to cool. Combine the rest of the ingredients together and drizzle the garlic and olive oils on top.  Finished.
